title: The slow twilight of Emmanuel Macron
summary: Seeing his influence decline after his decision to dissolve the Assemblée Nationale on June 9, which led him to appoint a prime minister without a majority and over whom he has no control, the French president has lost track of his second term.

title: Israel hits Lebanon in retaliation to Hezbollah attack, at least 9 killed
summary: Both Israel and Hezbollah faced accusations Monday of breaching the truce, which took effect on Wednesday to end a war that killed thousands of people in Lebanon and sparked mass displacements on both sides of the border.

title: War in Gaza: Aid deliveries for Palestinian refugees suspended through key crossing, following humanitarians deaths
summary: Two humanitarian workers were killed in the enclave on Saturday, November 30. Lack of security has forced UNRWA to halt aid at the crossing point between southern Gaza and Israel.

title: US announces new $725 mn package for Ukraine
summary: The Biden administration is racing to secure billions of dollars in aid for Ukraine before President-elect Donald Trump assumes office, a transition that could cast uncertainty over the future of US support for Kyiv.

title: International Court of Justice to decide on states' climate-related obligations
summary: The most vulnerable countries hope the ICJ will decide to strengthen the legal and financial obligations of those responsible for global warming. The hearings are scheduled to last two weeks.

title: Notre-Dame: What is planned for the cathedral's grand reopening on December 7
summary: Paris's Notre-Dame Cathedral is set to re-open on Saturday, with a planned weekend of ceremonies five years after the 2019 fire that ravaged the world heritage landmark and toppled its spire.

title: Norway stops planned seabed mining for a year
summary: As part of negotiations on the budget bill, the Socialist Left party obtained a temporary suspension on commercial-scale deep-sea mining. It's a victory for NGOs, who are now calling for a moratorium.

title: Judge strikes down Musk's $56 bn pay package despite shareholder vote
summary: Chancellor Kathaleen McCormick ruled on Monday that Tesla's attempt to ratify Elon Musk's compensation package through a shareholder vote could not override her previous decision, striking down the package as excessive and unfair.

title: Covid-19: Re­pub­lican-led ­com­mittee backs Chinese lab leak theory after two-year probe
summary: The 520-page report from the Republican-controlled American House Select Subcommittee on the Coronavirus Pandemic released on Monday looked at the federal and state-level response, as well as the pandemic's origins and vaccination efforts.

title: French PM forces social security budget bill without a vote, exposing his government to a no-confidence vote
summary: Michel Barnier, who lacks a majority in the Assemblée Nationale, activated article 49.3 of the Constitution on Monday. This move led to the tabling of two motions of no-confidence by the radical left and the far right.

title: Macron's visit to Saudi Arabia to focus on economic cooperation
summary: The French president hopes to secure contracts for France, even as Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman scales back his ambitious mega-projects at the heart of Vision 2030, the kingdom's strategy of modernization and economic diversification.

title: Georgian PM says there will be no 'revolution' in protest hit country
summary: Irakli Kobakhidze added that European Union integration remains a priority despite delaying membership talks until 2028 but insisted he would hold 'no negotiations' with the opposition.

title: COP16 to combat desertification kicks off in Riyadh
summary: Following the biodiversity and climate conventions, a United Nations conference began in Saudi Arabia on Monday. Its goal is to put the spotlight on the fight against land degradation, drought and desertification.

title: In Syria, Assad is trapped by his intransigence and the collapse of his regime
summary: The resurgence of the insurgency, which has regained control of Aleppo, highlights the Syrian government's failure to make concessions, inability to implement reform and break out of its isolation.

title: Far right makes spectacular breakthrough in Romania
summary: The country, which is of strategic importance to the West, could tip over to the pro-Russian camp after the second round of the presidential election on December 8.

title: Joe Biden pardons his son, contradicting his own pledge
summary: The outgoing US president insists that his son, convicted of tax fraud and possession of an illegal weapon, has been 'selectively, and unfairly, prosecuted.' Both cases were investigated by an independent prosecutor.

title: ICC president hits back at 'attacks' and 'threats'
summary: International Criminal Court head Tomoko Akanet lashed out against attacks on the court, which finds itself under the spotlight after issuing arrest warrants over wars in Gaza and Ukraine.

title: Volkswagen pulls out of Xinjiang and struggles to keep up in China
summary: Undermined by allegations of Uyghur forced labor, the German giant has sold its plant and test track in Xinjiang and has been overtaken by strong local competition in China, the world's largest market.

title: Trump wants to put Kash Patel, an open and outspoken enemy of the federal police, in charge of the FBI
summary: The law expert promised to close down the FBI's Washington headquarters 'on day one' and turn it into a 'museum of the deep state.' The president-elect will still need to obtain Senate confirmation.
